snippet: Americans lined up on Thursday night for the beginning of round-the-clock screenings.
abstract: Star Wars fans, who are waiting in line at American and Canadian theaters to see first showings of latest sequel The Force Awakens, seem motivated by nostalgia and hope to avoid social media spoilers; good reviews and pre-sale box-office earnings raises likelihood it will become best-selling movie in history.

byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and MICHAEL CIEPLY
byline.contributor: Adam Gold contributed reporting from Nashville; Anthony Cave contributed reporting from Key West, Fla.; Michael Cieply reported from Los Angeles and Brooks Barnes from New York.

lead_paragraph: Americans lined up on Thursday night for the beginning of round-the-clock screenings.

headline.main: ‘Star Wars’ Opens Amid Hype and Nostalgia
headline.print_headline: Overlords, Droids and Rebels Seize Box Office
